@mjturner1975 @StrongerInNos Yes, Or pop growth and GDP pc growth. Which is exactly what the IMF research does. (as multiple regression)
@StrongerInNos [try comparing your chart to a simple chart of population growth!!]
@StrongerInNos [sorry, first term minus second term. Cancels except for 2nd order (negligiblle) terms]
@StrongerInNos Wrong. You are charting [GDP (t)/GDP (t-1)- 1] divided by [GDP (t)/p(t) /GDP(t-1)/p(t-1)- 1]. Do the math. GDP cancels.
@jdportes @StrongerInNos @notayesmansecon ie, despite your labelling, there is literally *no* information/data on GDP in this chart..
@StrongerInNos ?? As a matter of arithmetic that's just population growth!
@erskineandrew Nothing quant I think because we lack good data on self-employed (a problem for lab market econ generally not just migration)
